Functions¶

class forms.LoginForm(formdata=<object object>, **kwargs)¶

This class is used whenever the user already has an account and wants to log in with it.

class forms.LogoutForm(formdata=<object object>, **kwargs)¶

This class is used when the user wants to log off from their account.

class forms.RegistrationForm(formdata=<object object>, **kwargs)¶

This class is used when the user wants to create an account

run.home()¶

What is seen on the homepage. All this is for like testing purposes for display on the main page. This all probably won’t show when the home page is done for real. Fitting main page description to be added in later. title = header author + date posted ==> By author on date posted content = Descriptions under all that

run.login()¶

Login page Realistically, if you have registered already, you go here. Takes all methods and validators to login.html and waits for input. Then it waits for validation from the submit button.

run.logout()¶

Logout form Currently does nothing and cannot be accessed Clicking would log out account Its here for the future

run.register()¶

Goes to Registration form in forms.py. Takes all methods and validators to register.html and waits for input. Then it waits for validation from the submit button.
